name: Montreal Bagels
description: Chewy bagels boiled in a sweet water bath for a classic Quebec treat.
ingredients:
227 g water
16g maple syrup
2 tsp yeast
390g to 420g flout
6g salt
100g sesame or poppy seeds(optional)
115g honey
directions:
1. Combine water, maple syrup, yeast, 390g flour and salt in a large bowl.
2. Mix until a firm dough forms.
3. Knead by hand until dough is smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Add remaining flour as needed.
4. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 1.5 hours.
5. Punch down dough and divide into 8 pieces of 80 - 85g.
6. Roll each piece into a ball. Poke a finger through the middle and stretch into a bagel shape.
7. Place on a parchment lined baking sheet. Cover and let rest while you do the next steps.
8. Preheat oven to 425F.
9. Fill a large pot with 3 litres water and honey. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer.
10. When bagels have puffed a little, simmer them in the water, 2 or 3 at a time, for 1 minute per side. 
11. Remove from water and dredge in seeds (optional).
12. Return to parchment paper. Bake 20 - 25 minutes.
13. Cool on a rack before serving.
